title: Physical boundary

properties.name: description
properties.value: A physical boundary is something in the area which does not allow a player to pass through it. Some examples of physical boundaries are:

content:
A physical boundary is something in the area which does not allow a player to pass through it. Some examples of physical boundaries are:

  • Walls
  • Fences
  • Locked doors or gates
  • Rocks
  • Prison bars
  • Trees
  • Plants
  • Barrels
  • Crates
  • Signposts
  • Ladders
  • Hedges

Some physical boundaries can be passed with certain skills (guild doors) or require certain Agility levels in order to pass.

Boundaries are generally taken advantage of when training Ranged or Magic to avoid the player from taking unnecessary combat damage. Members may also use a similar trick with the halberd; it can attack up to two squares away, instead of the normal one permitted by regular melee weapons.

There is a ladder you can only see if you are wearing the ring of visibility, which is for the Desert Treasure quest. If you take the ring off, you cannot see the ladder, and when you try to walk to where the ladder was, you will not go anywhere.
rawContent:
A '''physical boundary''' is something in the area which does not allow a player to pass through it. Some examples of physical boundaries are:

*Walls
*Fences
*Locked [[door]]s or gates
*Rocks
*Prison bars
*[[Trees]]
*Plants
*[[Barrel]]s
*[[Crate]]s
*Signposts
*[[Ladder]]s
*[[Hedge]]s

Some physical boundaries can be passed with certain skills ([[Guilds|guild]] doors) or require certain [[Agility]] levels in order to pass.

Boundaries are generally taken advantage of when training [[Ranged]] or [[Magic]] to avoid the player from taking unnecessary combat damage. Members may also use a similar trick with the [[halberd]]; it can attack up to two squares away, instead of the normal one permitted by regular [[Weapon#Melee Weapons|melee weapons]].

There is a ladder you can only see if you are wearing the [[ring of visibility]], which is for the [[Desert Treasure]] quest. If you take the ring off, you cannot see the ladder, and when you try to walk to where the ladder was, you will not go anywhere.
[[Category:Mechanics]]
